subtitle: there was a man called majnu who was
madly in love with his beloved
unfortunately he could not see her he
started to roam about in the forest
believing that if he saw a rose it would
be her he kissed the trees thinking they
were her he had transformed everything
around him into the body of his beloved
as long as majnu was alive he could not
see his beloved when majnu was brought
into the presence of God he was asked oh
fool why did you love so much a material
worldly object had you loved me with a
millionth part of the intensity of Love
which you wasted upon your lady love I
would have made you the Archangel of
Heaven majnu answered oh God I excuse
you for this but if you had desired to
be worshiped you should have become the
object of my love
when the object of Love overwhelms one's
mind senses and being to an extent that
everything else may be rejected in its
face it is nothing but bhakti yoga Even
moksh Heaven or any Divinity feels dull
when compared to Pure unconditional love
[Music]
the Sanskrit word bhakti is derived from
the root bhaj which means to Revere to
share to partake and to worship
primarily meaning devotion it
encompasses a range of meanings such as
attachment to love Faith and spiritual
knowledge bhakti is both a process and
the result of the Union between the
bhakt the worshiper and the bhagwan the
worshiped as a process bhakti is
complete subservience to the Divine will
and as an outcome it is an end in itself
the purpose of devotion is neither wish
fulfillment nor any higher purpose such
as Liberation or salvation it is a
simple concept of unconditional love
towards the object of devotion which may
be a theistic god an impersonal God a
living being or even a thought or
emotion This Love knows no expectations
fears or Rivals it expects nothing in
return and is purely unconditional the
sole purpose of loving is to immerse
oneself in an unending stream of divine
love love does not emerge out of fear
one does not love in order to avoid hell
but rather in the face of Love concepts
of Heaven hell Sin Karma and Liberation
are all transcended one becomes passive
in their actions as there is complete
surrender towards the Beloved all
actions are Guided by intense love love
of bhakti has no rival a person who is
truly in love will see the object of
their love as the highest ideal it may
be that in many cases human love is
misdirected and misplaced however to the
person who loves the thing they love is
always their highest ideal the ancient
Treatise on bhakti the Narada bhakti
Sutra explains the essence of bhakti in
its opening lines it is of the nature of
the highest love for this and of the
nature of the immortal Bliss on
attaining which a man becomes perfect
Immortal and satisfied Forever on
gaining which one wants nothing laments
over nothing it's nothing Delights in
nothing and is never enthusiastic in
anything Earthly experiencing which one
becomes exhilarated Beyond self-control
stands perfectly still and Revels in the
self the notion of Love is Central to
the idea of bhakti this love is an
emotional intense and passionate longing
for the Beloved not limited to the
Realms of physical or sexual desire it
involves an intense contemplation such
that the lover and beloved seem to
become one there is an annihilation of
separateness
a dissolution of the distinction between
me and not me unless the union is with
the entirety of creation the distinction
will persist hence in bhakti the Beloved
is the Supreme itself the one who is
both Creator and creation the
identification of self with the Supreme
occurs leading to complete fulfillment
satisfaction
desirelessness and eternal Bliss this
idea of Oneness Unity or communion to
the Supreme exists in different forms
across different cultures and religious
Traditions love is a universal emotion
and its spiritual manifestation is even
more so in ancient Greece Plato
described the idea of good as an
all-encompassing ideal equivalent to the
modern concept of God he described his
love for God as spiritual love which
helps soul to realize the true nature of
things in his words in order to know the
idea of good one must become the idea of
good modern philosopher Baruch Spinoza
described the concept of love as the
intellectual love of God it is the very
Love by which God loves himself it
constitutes the blessedness of one who
possesses it when such and love
dominates one's effective Life One
attains Serenity and freedom from
Passion and that is the mark of wisdom
the Sufi Mystics talk about the vision
and communion with God the
unconditionality of Love is visible in
the sacrifice of Jesus Christ for the
love of humankind and the compassion for
all living beings in Buddhism bhakti
while talking about these Concepts
filters of the intellectual jargon and
presents it in a simple form of
surrender to the Beloved the differences
in paths often hinder us from seeing the
truth good for what it is in his book
the journey within radhanath Swami
quotes the words of an acquaintance a
dog will recognize his master in
whatever dress he wears the master May
dress in robes or a suit and tie or
stand naked but the dog will always know
him if we cannot recognize God our
beloved Master when he appears in a
different dress in other religions then
we have much to learn from a dog
the forms of worship evolve from
sacrificial rituals sabianism and
animism from Vedic times to the
upanishadic concept of Brahma the
Ultimate Reality which is formless and
Beyond qualities during the 7th and 8th
centuries CE the practices had devolved
sections of society such as women and
those belonging to lower castes were not
allowed to worship as per traditional
methods the rituals had become too
complicated and expensive making worship
impossible for common people local
deities and tribal Gods gained
prominence it was at this time that the
bhakti movement started in the southern
parts of India it led to integration of
various practices social reform and
reduced emphasis on the ritual aspect of
bhakti the nayanars who worship Lord
Shiva and the alvars who worship Lord
Vishnu started composing and singing
hymns while traveling the tradition
spread northward and gave rise to Great
poet Saints in different parts of the
subcontinent spreading the message of
Love Harmony and peace the bhakti
movement not only paved the way for the
individual to meet God but also welcomed
all regardless of their castes genders
or financial status hence leading to
social change integrating various
Traditions the bhakti movement took many
forms the teachings of bhakti from
ancient scriptures such as the
upanishads Narada bhakti Sutra and
bhagavad-gita were combined with
traditions of poetry and singing great
Saints emerged during this period such
as Kabir Guru nanak mirabai ravidas
chaitanya mahaprabhu and many more
teachings of Islam were also
Incorporated giving rise to Sufism the
bhakti practices and theoretical aspects
had been previously standardized in the
Narada bhakti and bhagavad-gita these
aspects were later adopted and Modified
by bhakti yoga scenes to suit the
general population and adapt to Changing
Times
the goal of bhakti yoga is devotion
itself a bhakt does not care about
philosophy and metaphysics there is no
higher purpose of Liberation for them
Only Love Remains it is the means and
the end this love is absolute and not in
relation to hatred it is spiritual and
without expectations a true bhakt says I
may know that I am he yet I will take
myself away from him and become
different so that I may enjoy the
Beloved bhakti yoga is considered the
easiest yogic path to master and the
most direct method to experience the
unity of mind body and spirit whereas
Hut yoga requires a strong and flexible
body Raja yoga requires a disciplined
and concentrated mind and nyana yoga
requires a keen intellect the only
requirement for bhakti yoga is an open
loving heart
the Narada bhakti Sutra talks about the
constant remembrance of God in order to
perform bhakti yoga even if God is
Remembered in action through rituals in
speech through spiritual conversations
or in thought through constant
contemplation bhakti is incomplete the
19th verse states it is the offering of
all acts to him and feeling the highest
pangs of Separation on occasions of
losing remembrance of him the
bhagavad-gita explains that bhakti is of
two types saguna bhakti and nirguna
bhakti saguna means with qualities so in
saguna bhakti God as an object of love
has a form he is omnipotent omniscient
omnipresent and benevolent he has the
highest qualities is kind and
compassionate performs Miracles removes
evil and is the Creator sustainer and
destroyer of the world saguna bhakti
involves complete surrendered to God and
every action being dedicated to God all
organs the senses and the mind performs
their functions for the sake of God
nirguna bhakti means devoid of qualities
God is seen without any form or
attributes he is imminent and permeates
every atom of the universe God is the
truth good and beautiful he is the
Ultimate Reality he is one infinite
Eternal and indivisible surrender in
nirguna bhakti involves the welfare of
others as all beings are nothing but God
service to others is seen as a form of
worship in chapter 12 of the
bhagavad-gita Arjuna asks Lord Krishna
which type of bhakti is more dear to the
Lord sarguna or nirguna it is just like
asking a mother having two sons whom do
you love more the youngest son is a
little child deeply attached to his
mother who cannot bear separation from
her even for a moment the eldest son too
is full of love for the mother but he
has grown up and mature he can endure
separation from her he is admired by the
world and his reputation pleases his
mother if the mother is asked to choose
between them what would she do
nevertheless Lord Krishna answers any
devotee who fills his mind with my image
and worships with his mind centered on
me is the great Yogi the distinction is
futile when seen in the context of a
larger scheme of things saguna naturally
leads to nirguna in the process of
bhakti the bhakt realizes that any
supreme or ideal quality cannot
determine the Majesty of God any attempt
to describe God would limit him after
this realization they spent time loving
and helping their fellow beings who are
manifestations of God saguna bhakti is
necessary to reach nirguna bhakti
because without the object of bhakti
worship would not be possible
unconditional love cannot exist when
there is no definite object to love love
in bhakti can be expressed in various
forms the famous bhakti period Saint SRI
chaitanya once asked his favorite
disciple about the forms in which love
can be expressed the disciples said love
God as yourself this is only superficial
give me something deeper said chaitanya
the disciples said love God as your
child but caitanya was not impressed
this is also superficial he insisted the
disciple then cited the practice of
serving God a servant and the practice
of serving God as a friend but to no
avail all superficial said chaitanya
finally it downed on the disciple love
God as your lover that is the one it is
sweet said chaitanya approvingly the
unconditional love of a lover is pure
when the ABS of Love is the Supreme
Being the entire creation becomes
beloved God permits every existence and
every human being is seen as God all
being equal there is no discrimination
only compassion for every existence just
as a lover desires the well-being of the
Beloved a devotee desires the well-being
of the entire Cosmos
the modern world has become very
materialistic and consumption oriented
everything today has terms and
conditions including our emotions this
has taken away our freedom and we are
bound at all times in all aspects of Our
Lives by a transaction we have to pay
for using our senses speaking our
thoughts or even enjoying the creation
of nature lives have become much more
complicated our jobs relationships
leisure activities and creativity have
all become conditional everything is
being done in order to achieve something
else everything has become a means to an
end the end is perceived as success fame
or wealth but the end never arrives it
again becomes the means the constant
Desiring and working for it continues
until all age and death hence life is
spent with constant Cravings destroyed
relationships and failing Health a
person may become rich and successful by
but they never really enjoyed that
success this gives a dystopian view of
the materialistic world
the practice of bhakti yoga is capable
of curbing desires and making one
satisfied with what one has with bhakti
no Pride remains and everything is
granted by God by his grace the means
itself becomes the end no longer do you
love your partner for the sake of
physical intimacy or emotional support
rather you love for the sake of loving
you work hard for the joy of working
hard and do not get attached to the
outcome you stop seeing Supremacy in
power and wealth and instead turn
towards a fulfilling life the Holy Bible
has described the notion of love that is
unconditional and fulfilling love is
patient love is kind it does not envy it
does not boast it is not proud it does
not dishonor others it is not
self-seeking it is not easily angered it
keeps no record of wrongs foreign

humans have forgotten the essence of
being which is nothing but the emotion
of love love is seen not only in humans
but also in the animal kingdom on a
spiritual level even plants rocks rivers
and all elements of nature work together
to sustain life it is nothing but the
love of the Creator out of which
creation has occurred we forget this and
indulge ourselves in Petty conflicts
Pride sensual satisfaction and greed we
remain in the delusion that our
achievements and success are our own but
in reality everything we know is
transient this realization May induce an
existential crisis and lead to despair
